description: mounted to ivory paper; off-white over mat with gold and brown borders; enclosed courtyard/city square with tall curved wall with arches in distance; buildings at right and left; man shoeing a horse in foreground, LRC; figure on bucking horse at center; other figures along edges of square; tiny, neat inscriptions scattered throughout
inscription:
Inscription

in pen and brown ink: \"Laniara\" [mattress maker] / \"Quel da i sigilli\" [the maker of seals] / \"Horolagiaro\" [clock/watch maker] / \"Barigello\" [sheriff] / \"Adobatore\" [decorator] / \"Quel dalli fuochi artificiali\" [fireworks maker] / \"Quel delle feste\" [festival organizer] / \"Mercato d\'animali\" (animal market) / \"Cavallarizo\" [horseman]

LRC, in dark brown: [10]
medium: Pen and brown ink and wash over red chalk on laid paper
provenance: Sale, Sotheby's, London, June 21, 1974, no. '124, to Mathews; [Alister Mathews, Bournemouth, England, 1974; sold September 8, for Â£200, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1974-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: A City Square with Tradesmen
